options.name: New
Update

questions.question: What is the location of the hcf?

tooltip.text: This question contains a list of possible school locations, starting with government area or district, down to the community.

options.name: County
Sub-County
Ward
Community: Village or other urban unit
HCF name

tooltip.text: Record GPS coordinates of a central place in the HCF (e.g. outside main entrance)
List of HCF positions/roles

options.name: Nurse
Doctor
Public Health Officer
Clinical/Medical Officer
Medical Lab Technician
Pharmacist
Medical Superintendent
Director

tooltip.text: INTERVIEW: what is the total number of beds/inpatients in this healthcare facility?

questions.question: Change in number of patients attending the HCF?

options.name: Yes
No

questions.question: Update: total number of beds/inpatients in HCF

tooltip.text: INTERVIEW: what is the total number of beds/inpatients in this health care facility?

questions.question: Update: maximum number of outpatients in HCF

tooltip.text: INTERVIEW: what is the maximum number of outpatients in this health care facility?

questions.question: Main source of water supply for facility

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE & INTERVIEW: what is the main source of water supply for the facility?
Main source: if there is more than one water source, select the one used most frequently for drinking water

options.name: No water source
Surface water (lake, river, stream, dam)
Children bring water from home
Piped water supply inside the building
Piped water supply outside the building
Protected well/spring/borehole
Rainwater tank
Unprotected well/spring
Packaged water (bottles)
Tanker truck or cart
Other improved - specify

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE & INTERVIEW: is water from the main water source currently available at the facility?
Currently available: drinking water is available at the time of the interview, either from the main source directly or stored water originally from the main source

options.name: Yes
No

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE & INTERVIEW: is water available in sufficient quantity for all facility uses?
Sufficient quantity: water is available for handwashing, drinking, personal hygiene, medical activities, sterilization, decontamination, cleaning and laundry

options.name: No, insufficient water quantity (<75% uses)
No, water quantity only sufficient for 75% uses
Yes, sufficient water quantity for all uses

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: count the number of toilets for inpatients
OBSERVE: assess whether the inpatient toilets are usable (available, functional, and private). 
Available: toilet doors are unlocked or a key is available at all times; Functional: toilet is not broken, toilet hole is not blocked, and water is available for flushing (where required); Private: there are closable doors that lock from the inside and no large gaps in the toilet enclosure. If any of the three criteria are not met, the toilet is not counted as usable

options.name: All inpatient toilets are NOT usable (enter number)
Some inpatient toilets are NOT usable (enter number non-usable, and number usable)
All inpatient toilets are usable (enter number)

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: count the number of toilets for outpatients
OBSERVE: assess whether the outpatient toilets are usable (available, functional, and private)
Available: toilet doors are unlocked or a key is available at all times; Functional: toilet is not broken, toilet hole is not blocked, and water is available for flushing (where required); Private: there are closable doors that lock from the inside and no large gaps in the toilet enclosure

options.name: All outpatient toilets are NOT usable (enter number)
Some outpatient toilets are NOT usable (enter number non-usable, and number usable)
All outpatient toilets are usable (enter number)

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: What type of toilets are used by patients at the facility?
Toilet type: select the main type of toilet used
Pit latrine without slab: a dry toilet that does not have a squatting slab, platform or seat; or an open pit (or pit with large openings) where excreta are collected.
Pit latrine with slab: a dry toilet that collects excreta in a pit in the ground covered with a squatting slab or platform that is constructed from materials that are durable and easy to clean (e.g. concrete, bricks, stone, fibreglass, ceramic, metal, wooden planks or durable plastic)

options.name: No toilets
Open container toilets (e.g. bucket latrines)
Hanging latrines
Pit latrines without slab (open pit)
Flush or pour-flush toilets to open (field, open drain, water body)
Pit latrines with slab
Flush or pour-flush toilets to pit or tank
Flush or pour-flush toilets to sewer connection
Flush or pour-flush toilets to pit or tank
Composting toilets
Other improved toilet - specify

tooltip.text: OBSERVE: are separate toilets provided for use by facility staff?

options.name: No separate toilet exists for staff use, or toilets are unimproved
Toilet exists for staff use, but is not clearly designated or not functional
Yes, at least one functional toilet is clearly designated for staff

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: are sex-separated or gender-neutral toilets available?
Sex-separated toilets: rooms with multiple toilet stalls, or a private room with a single toilet, that are dedicated for use by either women or men
Gender-neutral toilet: a private room with a single toilet that allows women and men to use the toilet separately.

options.name: No records, or toilets cleaned less than once per day
Toilets cleaned less than twice a day
Yes, all toilets cleaned at least twice a day

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: is a toilet available with menstrual hygiene facilities?
Menstrual hygiene facilities: including water and soap available in a private space for washing, and a disposal bin for disposal of used menstrual hygiene products

options.name: No appropriate facilities are available or functional for menstrual hygiene
Space is available to wash, but with inadequate facilities
Yes, usable toilet is available with menstrual hygiene facilities

questions.question: Toilets accessible for people with reduced mobility

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: is a toilet accessible for people with reduced mobility?
Accessible for people with reduced mobility: can be accessed without stairs or steps; handrails provided for support; door is at least 80cm wide; and door handle and toilet seat are within reach of people using wheelchairs, crutches or walking sticks

options.name: No appropriate toilets available for people with reduced mobility
Toilet is inadequate for people with reduced mobility
Yes, at least one usable toilet is available for people with reduced mobility

questions.question: Availability of handwashing facilities at points of care

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: is there a functional hand hygiene facility at all points of care?
Functional hand hygiene facility: any device that enables staff, patients and visitors to clean their hands effectively, including a basin/pan with soap and water, or alcohol-based hand rub (ABHR).
Points of care: any location in the health care facility where care or treatment is delivered (e.g. consultation or exam room).

options.name: Less than 75% of Points of Care have functional hand hygiene facilities
75% or more Points of Care have functional hand hygiene facilities
Yes, all Points of Care have functional hand hygiene facilities

questions.question: Availability of handwashing facilities at facility toilets

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: do all facility toilets have a functional hand hygiene facility within 5m?
Functional hand hygiene facility for toilets: must be working, must include soap and water (NOT ABHR, as ABHR does not remove faecal matter), and must be within 5m of the toilet

options.name: Less than 50% of toilets have hand hygiene facilities within 5 metres
50% or more of toilets have functioning hand hygiene facilities within 5 metres
All toilets have functional hand hygiene facilities within 5 metres

questions.question: Regular audit of availability of hand hygiene materials

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: are audit records (of hand hygiene materials) available dated less than three months ago?
Regular audit: audits are undertaken every three months
Availability of hand hygiene materials: all hand hygiene facilities in the ward have hand rub, soap, single-use towels and other hand hygiene resources available

options.name: No audit records available, or no materials available
Ward-based audits are incomplete or irregular
Records available of regular ward-based audits reporting sufficient materials

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: are separate, functional waste collection containers available in close proximity to waste generation points for non-infectious (general) waste, infectious waste and sharps waste?
Separate functional waste collection containers: "3-bin" system with at least three containers that are leak-proof, covered with a lid, and clearly labelled (by colour/label or symbol). Bins should not be more than three-quarters full.

options.name: No waste collection containers or no segregation
Not all waste generation points have functional waste collection containers
All waste generation points have functional waste collection containers separated by waste type

tooltip.text:
INTERVIEW: is there a functional disposal site for non-infectious waste?
Functional disposal site: operational burial pit, fenced waste dump or municipal pickup point
Inadequate disposal site: Open dumping, open burning, no waste collection or segregation

options.name: No disposal site
Disposal site is inadequate or non-functional
Yes, functional disposal site

questions.question: Management of infectious waste and sharps

tooltip.text:
INTERVIEW: is there a functional disposal site for infectious waste and sharps waste?
Functional disposal site: operational incinerator or autoclave on-site, or licensed waste management service for off-site disposal
Inadequate disposal site: Open dumping, open burning, added to general waste (without treatment)

options.name: No disposal site
Disposal site is inadequate or non-functional
Yes, functional disposal site

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: are appropriate materials available for cleaning?
Appropriate cleaning materials: detergent, mops, buckets etc

options.name: No cleaning materials
Inadequate cleaning materials
Yes, cleaning materials available

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: is a record of cleaning activities (by day) available in the facility?
Daily cleaning record: details of cleaning activities undertaken on each day, signed by cleaners and counter-signed by supervisors

options.name: No cleaning records
Inadequate cleaning records
Yes, daily cleaning records available for all areas

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: do the cleaning roster and cleaning records confirm that toilets are cleaned twice a day?
Cleaning roster: schedule specifying responsibility for cleaning tasks, frequency of cleaning, and step-by-step protocol for specific cleaning tasks
Daily cleaning record: details of cleaning activities undertaken on each day, signed by cleaners and counter-signed by supervisors

options.name: No records, or toilets cleaned less than once per day
Toilets cleaned less than twice a day
Yes, all toilets cleaned at least twice a day
